title: Share of economic sectors in the GDP in Portugal 2008 to 2018
summary: This is a multi-line chart with 3 lines representing Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis denotes Share in GDP and the x axis denotes Year.
Overall Agriculture, Industry, and Services are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Services, 2. Industry, and lastly, 3. Agriculture.
Overall across the Year, Services mostly maintained the highest Share in GDP when compared to others with a mean value of 65.95, and it peaked at 2013.
After Services, Industry overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 19.4, peaking at 2008.
The botommost line, Agriculture,  has a mean of 2.01, and peaked at 2013, 2015, and 2017.

max_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis indicates the Share in GDP and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Agriculture, Industry, and Services are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Share in GDP in descending order is: 1. Services, 2. Industry, and lastly, 3. Agriculture.
Throughout the period, Services generally had the highest Share in GDP relative to others with an average of 65.95, and it reached its maximum at 2013 with a value of 66.9.
After Services, Industry overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 19.4, peaking at 2008.
Agriculture mostly had the least Share in GDP with a mean value of 2.01, which peaked at 2013, 2015, and 2017 with a value of 2.1.
Agriculture reported the lowest Share in GDP about 1.83 in Year 2011
